text: Elizabeth M. Ryan (January 4, 1923 – May 1998) was an American competition swimmer who represented the United States at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin, Germany. As a 13-year-old, Ryan swam for the third-place U.S. team in the preliminary heats of the women's 4×100-meter freestyle relay, helping the Americans qualify for the event final. Under the 1936 Olympic swimming rules, she did not receive a medal because she did not swim in the final. ==External links== * Category:1923 births Category:1998 deaths Category:American female freestyle swimmers Category:Olympic swimmers of the United States Category:Sportspeople from New York City Category:Swimmers at the 1936 Summer Olympics
title: Elizabeth Ryan (swimmer)
